name.text: Extreme Beer Fest (2016)
name.html: Extreme Beer Fest (2016)

description.text:
Extreme Beer Fest is the ultimate throwdown of craft beer creativity. Join us as we celebrate brewers who push the boundaries of brewing and raise a fist at the norm. Minds will be blown. Palates will be inspired. Prepare for epicness. 
Hosted by BeerAdvocate. Sponsored by Dogfish Head Craft Brewery. Don't accept (l)imitations. 
February 5 & 6, 2016 #Boston 
By purchasing fest tickets, or attending the fest, all attendees agree to any and all rules, restrictions, and forfeit any claims of liability as outlined here and on any and all fest related materials. Please read all fest info before purchasing tickets. 
For more fest info: http://www.beeradvocate.com/ebf/

name.text: Boston Wine Expo 2016
name.html: Boston Wine Expo 2016

description.text:
Discover an extraordinary world of great wine and food at the 25th Anniversary of the Boston Wine Expo. The 2016 Boston Wine Expo will be pouring more than 1,800 wines from over 200 wineries from around the world, as well as featuring amazing food from some of Boston’s best restaurants, making this anniversary year a feast for the senses. With our Silver Anniversary theme you’ll learn about what’s happened with wine over the last 25 years and more importantly what wine and food trends are emerging for the next 25 years!  Watch Boston’s best chefs cook on our two celebrity chef stages and learn about the world of wines. With great food and great wine it’s the perfect way to celebrate Valentine’s Day, and with President’s Day falling on the Monday after the Expo you can extend your weekend an extra day!   
For more details visit us online at www.WineExpoBoston.com
 
ALL TICKET SALES ARE FINAL. NO REFUNDS. NO CHANGES CAN BE MADE TO YOUR TICKET ORDER.  

PROMO CODE: If you have a Promotion/Discount Code, click on "Enter Discount Code" above to enter it.  FAQs Below are FAQs related to ticketing. For general event FAQs click here. 

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? All attendees must be 21+ with proper identification. No chidren, infants, toddlers will be allowed into the event. 
What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? Parking is available at the Seaport Hotel. 
Seaport Boston Parking Garage - 1 Seaport Lane, Boston, MA 02210  Over 2,300 underground spaces for safe, convenient parking in Boston. From valet to self-parking, the Seaport Boston Parking Garage is located beneath the Seaport Hotel, and offers quick and convenient access on D Street, B Street, Seaport Boulevard, and Congress Street. Direct elevator access is also available from the Seaport Boston Parking Garage to the lobbies of Seaport Hotel, Seaport West, and Seaport East.  Maximum garage height is 6'10".  Self Parking Rates: 0-1 hours - $11  1-2 hours - $22  2 - 3 hours - $27  3 - 6 hours - $30  6 - 10 hours - $32  10-24 hours - $36 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? You must have a printed copy of your ticket or your ticket barcode (easily viewable) on your smartphone. 
What is the refund policy? All ticket sales are final. No refunds or exchanges will be permitted. The event will happen in all weather conditions.    The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? Yes, you may purchase a ticket and give your ticket to another individual.

name.text: The Ugly Sweater Run- Boston: 12/12/2015
name.html: The Ugly Sweater Run- Boston: 12/12/2015

description.text:
Rummage up the ugliest sweater you can find and celebrate the Holidays by participating in the Merriest 5k of the year! Join thousands of runner and walkers from around the nation at the local Ugly Sweater Run Near you. If you’ve never run a 5K before, this is a great way to burn some calories before receiving hot chocolate and a beer. All you have to do is register online to join in all the fun. All kids 5 and under are FREE. 
  
The run is approximately 3.1 miles long on city streets though parks depending on the city. The start line will have huge inflatables, photo stations, and awesome holiday music. Once you’re on the course, you’ll find holiday themed stations at every mile. You can ditch that Gatorade because you’ll be able to replenish those electrolytes at the good ol’ fashioned hot chocolate station on the course. 
  
After you’ve completed your run, join us at the post run festivities. This holiday 5k has everything your five-year old self would want with a few perks of adulthood. So after the race, take a much deserved break from the shopping frenzy and celebrate your run with a beer and other holiday goodies. Awards for best mustache, best fake mustache, best beard, and worst sweater will follow the race. 
  
Each Ugly Sweater runner receives a custom vintage knit hat, unlimited hot chocolate, and one beer  (if you’re of age of course!). A closed course full of Hot Chocolate aide stations, snow blowers, and the biggest Santa inflatable around will await you. Make sure to enter the ugly sweater contests to win great prizes. What are you waiting for? Register now! 
  
NO DOGS! 
  
For more information visit our website: www.theuglysweaterrun.com 
  
Please Note: Human Movement Management has a no refund/transfer policy. Along with our policy, if a venue is changed from the original advertised venue, and is still an hour and a half from the advertised city, a refund will not be given.

name.text: Minority Business Expo
name.html: Minority Business Expo

description.text:
Event Overview 
The Minority Business Expo is created to increase opportunities for small businesses and entrepreneurs. It is also an opportunity to capture prospective clients and customers in a well facilitated environment. We provide the support and resources for small businesses and entrepreneurs, by being a platform for learning opportunities to stabilize and advance their success. The expo will have an array of businesses from the community and business support companies.  
Guests will attend from all over the city and will range from professionals, business owners, entrepreneurs, event specialists, community organizations, local personalities, special guest honorees, friends, family, and many more.  
  
Objectives & Goals 
Our objectives and goals for the Minority Business Expo are set below: 
·         Present the communal effort to partner with potential clientele including local businesses, agencies, entrepreneurs, community organizations, specialists, and local vendors. 

Raise awareness on the importance of community building and outreach throughout Greater Boston.
For each vendor and attendee to walk away empowered with a comprehensive plan for their success. 
To help businesses increase their revenue by at least 50%

  
Our Mission 
We facilitate the sharing of knowledge and building of professional relationships within the Boston business community. Our events provide a forum for people to meet and exchange ideas.  
Expand your network by connecting with people small businesses.  Our events are specifically designed to maximize your opportunity for meeting contacts, new business leads and ultimately increasing revenue. 
  
Why our expo? 
1. It will give vendors the platform to Connect with potential clientele and other businesses that can help further success. It is an electrifying networking experience, packed with great people and useful information. 
2. To Empower those that are in business or those that are aspiring to be in business. We take every experience as a growing experience. Our workshops are great opportunities for structured and facilitated learning. 
 3. And finally to Grow. If we are living we ought to be growing. Success is simply growth. If you take advantage of your failures and pair it with your achievements, my friend you have unleashed the secret to your success. 
  
For more information please visit our website at  
www.MinorityBusinessExpo.Org

name.text: BIG: Boston Innovators Group (fka WebInno)
name.html: BIG: Boston Innovators Group (fka WebInno)

description.text:
WebInno -- Boston's most popular recurring tech event for more than 10 years -- has relaunched as BIG! Join us to celebrate the beginning of the next decade of early-stage startups in Boston. 
Open to everyone in the community. 
On Twitter: Use the hashtag #BIG1 and follow us at @BIGinnovators. 
  
Agenda: 
6:30pm: Arrival, Cash Bar, General Mingling 
7pm: "Main Dish" Demos will present on stage: 

Driftt: all the tools and data you need to unlock long term, valuable relationships with your existing customers.
Price Intelligently: get more out of SaaS through their pricing and SaaS analytics platform.
CabinetM: discover the best marketing tools. 

6-9pm: "Side Dish" Demos will demo throughout the night: 

Cintell: a customer intelligence platform that helps companies better understand their buyers through SmartPersonas.
Eager: makes it easy for website owners who are not technical to use the thousands of amazing open source and SaaS tools previously only available to web developers.
Metacog: inject powerful data and machine learning capabilities into your 21st Century products.
Hello Token: enables content producers to earn revenue without ads via one-click research surveys
Databox: mobile app that lets you know when important things change in your business.
ShipFoliage: foliage as a Service (FaaS). Ship only the finest New England fall foliage to friends & family.

name.text: Boston: Open Doors Party
name.html: Boston: Open Doors Party

description.text:
Join our program director, alumni, current students, hiring partners, and members of the tech community for an evening of making new connections, reuniting, and having fun. 
We're a community of awesome people. Together we are making huge contributions to the tech ecosystem and building great companies. Our Fall Open Doors Celebration is an opportunity for us to come together to celebrate this growing community.  
This event is open to everyone in the community.  Do you know someone who is wonderful and might want to join our community?  Bring them along!   
Our Open Doors Party is being held at Central Bistro in Downtown Crossing. The entrance is above Pret a Manager. Drinks and light snacks will be served.  
Tell your friends, connect with others, and say hello with #SIOpenDoors on Twitter.  

  
Thanks to: 
OUR EVENT SPONSORS 
 
 
  
  
OUR PROGRAM SPONSORS 
 
 
 
 
 
OUR EVENT HOST

name.text: Boston magazine's 6th Annual Taste
name.html: Boston magazine's 6th Annual Taste

description.text:
November 17th | Boston Children’s Museum 308 Congress St. Boston  
Tickets are now on sale for the 6th annual Taste event! Join us on November 17th to celebrate the anticipated November Restaurants issue with an evening of delectable offerings while working to end hunger in our city. A portion of proceeds from your ticket will benefit The Greater Boston Food Bank. 
Event is 21 plus. Rain or shine. Tickets will not be sold at the door. Ticket sales end at 11am on event day. 
As the purchaser of Taste tickets you will receive a 1 year (12 issue) subscription to Boston magazine valued at $7.95, which is included in the event ticket price. The first issue should arrive in 6-8 weeks. You may cancel the subscription and receive a refund using the link provided in the confirmation email. 
General Admission: 

Taste delectable offerings from Boston’s hottest chefs--newcomers and classics
All you can eat food and drink
Meet the chefs and see them in action
Sip on custom cocktails, a selection of thirst quenching beers and delectable wines
Enjoy live music
Support The Greater Boston Food Bank and their mission to end hunger in our city
Enjoy relaxing and interactive lounges
Explore the museum

VIP Admission: 

Access to all General Admission items, plus:
Beat the crowds and gain access to the event an hour early
Bring home a VIP gift bag with offerings from sponsors, chefs and more!

Thank you to our event sponsors, who will all be on-site with exciting products and activations: 
Infiniti, Basil Hayden, Stella Artois, Barbados Tourism, Polar Beverages, Robert, Israel & Weiner, W Boston, The Daily Press Juice Bar, Vermont Creamery

name.text: Boston Beer and Cheese Fest
name.html: Boston Beer and Cheese Fest

description.text:
If you’re in the know, you realize that beer and cheese go together in ways most people wouldn’t believe…if you DON’T think that beer and cheese are a magical pairing, then the Boston Beer & Cheese Fest 2016 will be a wake-up call that you can’t miss! Last year sold out over a month in advance, so we're going BIGGER and BETTER this year! 
25 craft beer and cider makers from New England; 10 New England creameries. 25 beer/cider & cheese pairings. Yep. Get on this! 
Find out why Drink Craft Beer was awarded Boston magazine's Best of Boston® 2014 - Best Booze Fest! 
TICKETS WILL BE ON TUESDAY, OCTOBER 27TH AT 10AM. SIGN UP FOR OUR EMAIL LIST HERE TO FIND OUT AS SOON AS THEY'RE AVAILABLE. 
Please Note: 

There are no refunds OR exchanges.
All attendees must be 21+ with a valid ID. Nobody will be allowed into the building who is under 21 or who doesn't have a valid ID.
Tickets will be emailed by Eventbrite. You must bring this ticket to the event where it will be scanned.
You can transfer tickets using Eventbrite.
We give no entry guarantee if you buy your ticket from a reseller.

Boston Beer & Cheese Fest March 11th & 12th 
The Cyclorama - 539  Tremont Street, Boston, MA VIP Session - Friday, March 11th: 6-9:30pm Session 2 - Saturday, March 12th: 1-4:30pm Session 3 - Saturday, March 12th: 6-9:30pm 
 
Why Join Us At Boston Beer & Cheese Fest? 
It’s craft beer, cider and cheese…what more do you need to know?! If you do need more info, though, the Boston Beer & Cheese Fest focuses on New England-made craft beers, ciders and cheeses. By attending you’ll have access to over 80 craft beers and ciders from 25 local brewers/cideries, as well as tons of cheese from 10 local creameries. If that’s not enough, we’ll be pairing a beer/cider from each brewer with a cheese from each creamery…that’s 25 beer/cider and cheese pairings! If that doesn’t make your mouth water, we don’t know what else to say. 
How Much Does It Cost? 
For only $50 you’ll get admittance to one session which includes: 

Unlimited 2oz samples of 80+ New England craft beers & ciders from 25 breweries & cideries
Unlimited samples of cheese from 10 New England creameries
Biodegradable tasting cup
Fest Guide


VIP Session - How Much Does It Cost? 

For only $60 you'll get admittance to the VIP Session on Friday night, which includes:


All of the above, plus unlimited 2oz samples of 25 super-limited New England craft beers & ciders, including casks and other delights
A chance to vote on the 2015 Champion of Hops...a championship belt to be awarded to the brewers of the crowd's favorite VIP beer/cider
The session will be limited to only 650 attendees (down from 800 for the Saturday sessions)
Some possible other things we're working on...totally TBD at this point still what will make it to the event


What Creameries Will be Joining? 
We’re working with local cheese experts to get a great, diverse selection of local cheeses that will pair excellently with beer and cider. We have the following creameries committed, with more to come (NOTE: This is only a partial list. Creameries/cheeses are subject to change and availability): 

The Cellars at Jasper Hill (VT)
The Grey Barn & Farm (MA)
Vermont Creamery (VT)

What Breweries/Cideries Will be Joining? 
We'll have 25 New England breweries and cideries in attendance bringing 90+ craft beers and ciders. Some of our brewers include the following (NOTE: This is only a partial list. We'll continue to announce more of our brewers and beers in the coming weeks) (Brewers and beers are subject to change and availability. All pours are 2oz or less per MA State Law):

Urban Farm Fermentory (ME)
Wormtown Brewing Co. (MA)

name.text: BostInno's 50 on Fire
name.html: BostInno's 50 on Fire

description.text:
Recognizing innovators, disrupters, luminaries and newsmakers, 50 on Fire celebrates visonary individuals and companies across Boston's hottest industries 
Join us on December 3 at the Moakely Courthouse to celebrate the people and organizations driving innovation in Boston. Attendees will experience an exclusive first look at the 2015 50 on Fire award winners through a high-octane video premiere. 50 on Fire will be a night to remember with delicious food and drink, music and dancing, and celebrations with Boston's best and brightest.  
Be on the lookout for more details regarding our 50 on Fire meetup series leading up to the big event on December 3.  
  

Do you know someone setting the Boston scene on fire? Nominations for the 50 on Fire awards are open now!  

  
Cocktail attire suggested. 
Event is strictly 21+. Attendees must have photo ID to enter. 
No refunds.  
  
  
Thank you to our sponsors! 
 
  
  
  
Please contact us to learn more about how you can align your brand with 50 on Fire.

name.text: Lovin' Spoonfuls Ultimate Tailgate Party 2015
name.html: Lovin' Spoonfuls Ultimate Tailgate Party 2015

description.text:
Tickets for the Ultimate Tailgate Party will be on sale Monday, September 28th at 10am.  
  
 
Lovin' Spoonfuls Ultimate Tailgate Party 
  
The Party 
On Sunday, November 22nd, 2015, Lovin' Spoonfuls will host the 5th annual Ultimate Tailgate Party all while overlooking Boston’s scenic waterfront at Cruiseport Boston. The annual event features 24 of Boston’s “MVP” chefs cooking high-end versions of their favorite tailgate food, a silent auction, entertainment and much more. Beer, wine, and cocktails will be shaken and served by Peak Organic Brewing, MS Walker, and Bombay Sapphire. In keeping with the tailgate theme, the DJ for the New England Patriots and the Boston Red Sox, TJ Connelly, will be our DJ for the evening. 
This year, we are thrilled to honor Culinary Board member and Bizarre Foods host Andrew Zimmern with the Thomas M. Menino Award for Leadership during the VIP hour, for his continued support of our work. The VIP hour also features sparkling wine, cheeses from Wasik's Cheese Shop, and charcuterie from Josh Smith of New England Charcuterie.  The theme of the event resonates the 'Spoonfuls mission: combatting hunger is a team sport! 
With a new location, more restaurants, and more fun - it's bound to be the best event yet, with even more ways to support our work! 
  
The Mission 

More than 700,000 Massachusetts residents are classified as food insecure, meaning they don't know where their next meal will come from. Since its founding in 2010, the Lovin' Spoonfuls team has collected more than 3,000,000lbs of fresh, healthy food that would otherwise be thrown away, and distributed it at no cost to local soup kitchens, homeless shelters and crisis centers throughout the city. Last year’s ultimate tailgate party allowed us to put another truck on the road, increasing our ability to pick up and drop off rescued food, and this year aims to do the same! 

  
The Chefs 
This year an even bigger all-star team of Boston’s premiere chefs will once again join the party by cooking their own creative takes on their favorite tailgate food. Guests will be able to enjoy creative comfort food from Lovin’ Spoonfuls culinary board members Jamie Bissonnette (Coppa and Toro), Joanne Chang (Myers + Chang and Flour Bakery), and Michael Scelfo (Alden & Harlow). The event will also welcome: 

Karen Akunowicz & Joanne Chang (Myers + Chang)
Louis DiBiccari (Tavern Road)
Matthew Gaudet (West Bridge)
Will Gilson (Puritan & Co.)
Tiffani Faison (Sweet Cheeks and the forthcoming Tiger Mama)
Daniel Bojorquez (La Brasa)
Jason Cheek (Sam's)
Steve Postal (Commonwealth)
Christine & Carla Pallotta (Nebo)
Stephanie Cmar (Fairsted Kitchen)
the team from Mei Mei Street Kitchen
Michael Cooney & John Paine (Brewer's Fork)
Tim Wiechmann (Bronwyn) 
Michael Serpa (Select Oyster Bar)
James DiSabatino (Roxy's Grilled Cheese)
Cassie Piuma (Sarma)
the team from Shake Shack
Matthew Jennings (Townsman)
Andy Husbands (Tremont 647 and the forthcoming Smoke Shop)
Suzi Maitland (Trina's Starlite Lounge, Audobon)
Jake Rojas (Tallulah's Taqueria from Providence, RI)
Andrew Foster & Mike Wiley (Portland, Maine's Eventide Oyster Bar).  


  
Tickets and Schedule of Events 
The party kicks off with an exclusive VIP hour featuring a dazzling display of cheese & charcuterie, courtesy of Wasik's Cheese Shop and New England Charcuterie, from 6:00pm - 7:00pm. A limited number of VIP tickets are available for $250, which allows guests entry into the VIP hour and includes all the cheese and charcuterie you desire, champagne, a meet & greet with the chefs, exclusive "buy it now" privileges for all silent auction items, entrance into the VIP raffle featuring unique prizes, and a VIP gift bag full of swag from some of our local supporters. Last but certainly not least, join us during the VIP hour for an intimate celebration honoring Andrew Zimmern. Guests at the VIP hour will have the opportunity for a meet & greet with Andrew.  
The main event will start at 7:00pm, and general admission tickets are $150. The ticket price includes access to chefs tasting stations and complimentary cocktails from Bombay Sapphire, beer from Peak Organic Brewery, as well as wine and bubbles from sponsor M.S. Walker. The Tailgate Party will also feature a silent auction with exclusive food and travel experiences, plus a photo booth stocked with everyone's favorite football memorabilia.  
  
Tailgate Host Committee 
A special thank you to members of this year's Ultimate Tailgate Host Committee:  

Allison Allen & Chris Jones
Hannah & Chris* Brennan
Sandy Cades*
Lisa Hughes & Michael Casey
Joanne Chang* & Christopher Myers*
Aimee Corrigan & Ashley Stanley*
Anna Freedman
Kimberly & Marcus Hatfield
Dorene & Duncan Higgons
Janet & Andrew Horelick
Sherri Pearl Horn & Jonathan Horn
Rebecca & Rob Lucente
Linda & David Mooney
Karen Nevins*
Siobhan & Michael O'Connell
Maggie & Jeff Peterson
Dorothy Puhy*
Ellen & Michael* Scelfo
Caren L. Stanley
Terry & Rob Wadsworth
Stacy Walker
Connie & Rob Walkingshaw
Arlan & Brad Wasik
Mariann & Andy* Youniss, Chairs

  
*Lovin' Spoonfuls Board Member 
  
Thank you to our generous sponsors for this year's Ultimate Tailgate Party! 



 







DOROTHY PUHY




 






 
©2015. BOMBAY SAPPHIRE IS A REGISTERED TRADEMARK. IMPORTED BY THE BOMBAY SPIRITS COMPANY U.S.A., CORAL GABLES, FL. GIN – 47% ALC. BY VOL.
 
  
The fair market value of goods and services provided at the event is $50. The tax deductible portion of a General Admission ticket is $100, for VIP $200.

description.text:
Are you interested in joining a team for the President’s Challenge or Deans’ Challenges? Come hear from up to 35 teams who are looking for team members like you and meet like-minded individuals from across Harvard at our third annual Pitch, Mix, and Match! 
If you would like to pitch your idea/venture at this event, you MUST register by Friday, November 6, 2015. 
NOTE: We will have a direct "Longwood to i-lab" bus for this event (one trip). More info will be sent to registrants.    If you are a clinical fellow, please register as "Other Harvard Affiliations" and select "Fellow (pre- or post-doc)" in the subsequent question.

name.text: NEXPO Fall 2015 - GEW 2015
name.html: NEXPO Fall 2015 - GEW 2015

description.text:
Come and experience what's next. 
What is NEXPO? 
NEXPO is Northeastern's premier entrepreneurship exposition. The culmination of Global Entrepreneurship Week, NEXPO will feature IDEA startups and the resources all around campus that support them. The event will celebrate the breadth of entrepreneurship throughout Northeastern's campus and showcase all it has to offer. 
What's new about NEXPO this year? 
This year, you get to experience the process of an IDEA venture. Participate in a customer validation interview. Experience a product demo. Give feedback on an investor pitch. Meet service providers, mentors, and partners from on-organizations like Scout, Husky Startup Challenge, and Entrepreneurs Club. 
Who should attend?  
Anyone who is interested in hearing about what's coming next from the Northeastern entrepreneurship ecosystem. Whether you're a student curious about starting your own company or an industry professional looking to share your experiences, NEXPO provides the perfect platform to connect with entrepreneurship at Northeastern. 
For more information about IDEA | Northeastern University's Venture Accelerator, please visit http://www.northeastern.edu/idea  
Learn more about NEXPO and Global Entrepreneurship Week at: http://www.northeastern.edu/eweek/ 
For a campus map please visit:  http://www.northeastern.edu/campusmap/printable/campusmap.pdf

name.text: 6th Annual Local Craft Brewfest
name.html: 6th Annual Local Craft Brewfest

description.text:
I'm Thirsty! 
  
Join us for Sustainable Business Network of Massachusetts’ (SBN) 6th Annual Local Craft Brewfest at the Cruiseport Boston located at 1 Black Falcon, Boston - at our new location on Boston harbor. We’ll be the first Brewfest at the Cruiseport! Hosted by SBN and the Boston Local Food Festival Committee. Expanded this year with a new location, Local Craft Brewfest will gather over 1,000 local brew fans to celebrate together with dozens of local vendors. Come taste, discover, socialize and network with dozens of local craft breweries, distilleries, cideries, meaderies, artisan beverage brewers, and local food producers! While celebrating local brews, you can participate in cocktail demos and cool games while savoring live music by Coastal Flux Band and enjoy one of Boston’s finest harbor views. 
  
Local Craft Brewfest is affiliated with and is a major annual fundraiser for the Annual Boston Local Food Festival, considered New England's largest one day Farmers Market and a celebration of local food. The brewfest will take place inside and outside of the Cruiseport Boston with the awesome view from Boston Harbor. More than 120 local tastings and local food bites will be featured and local food will be on sale for only $6 or less per serving size. It’s a great opportunity to meet local brewmasters and owners of local food producers and eateris who are as passionate about local food as you are! VIP tickets are back and this year we’re amping them up!  
  
We are putting more value towards your VIP tickets with:  

Early admission starting at 6:00 pm 
Fast lane check-in + Swag 
One meal voucher to redeem at any of the participating food vendors (including food trucks) 
$10 off towards the 2016 SBN’s 5th Hyper-Local Craft Brewfest at The Armory, Somerville 
More surprises to come! 

  
What's included with the general admission ticket?  

Unlimited tastings from our participating brewers, craft brewers, distilleries, cideries, meaderies, artisan beverage vendors 
Unlimited samples from participating local food vendors 
Access to purchase delicious local food for only $6 or less per serving 
Live music and entertainment 
Festival Guide with listing of all vendors 
Compostable tasting cup 
Cocktail demos
Cool games
One of the finest views from Boston Harbor 
Supporting the local food movement by raising much needed funds for the Boston Local Food Program 

  
Sponsors 



 
 



  
 
  
  


Over the past 10 years, Boston has seen a re-birth of interest in food. Whether it’s the opening of a farmers market in your town, the interest chefs have in using local products or the increase in specialty food stores, we are seeing an emphasis on seasonal and local food. description.html:
I'm Thirsty!

Join us for Sustainable Business Network of Massachusetts’ (SBN) 6th Annual Local Craft Brewfest at the Cruiseport Boston located at 1 Black Falcon, Boston - at our new location on Boston harbor. We’ll be the first Brewfest at the Cruiseport! Hosted by SBN and the Boston Local Food Festival Committee. Expanded this year with a new location, Local Craft Brewfest will gather over 1,000 local brew fans to celebrate together with dozens of local vendors. Come taste, discover, socialize and network with dozens of local craft breweries, distilleries, cideries, meaderies, artisan beverage brewers, and local food producers! While celebrating local brews, you can participate in cocktail demos and cool games while savoring live music by Coastal Flux Band and enjoy one of Boston’s finest harbor views.

Local Craft Brewfest is affiliated with and is a major annual fundraiser for the Annual Boston Local Food Festival, considered New England's largest one day Farmers Market and a celebration of local food. The brewfest will take place inside and outside of the Cruiseport Boston with the awesome view from Boston Harbor. More than 120 local tastings and local food bites will be featured and local food will be on sale for only $6 or less per serving size. It’s a great opportunity to meet local brewmasters and owners of local food producers and eateris who are as passionate about local food as you are! VIP tickets are back and this year we’re amping them up!

We are putting more value towards your VIP tickets with:

  • Early admission starting at 6:00 pm
  • Fast lane check-in + Swag
  • One meal voucher to redeem at any of the participating food vendors (including food trucks)
  • $10 off towards the 2016 SBN’s 5th Hyper-Local Craft Brewfest at The Armory, Somerville
  • More surprises to come!

What's included with the general admission ticket?

  • Unlimited tastings from our participating brewers, craft brewers, distilleries, cideries, meaderies, artisan beverage vendors
  • Unlimited samples from participating local food vendors
  • Access to purchase delicious local food for only $6 or less per serving
  • Live music and entertainment
  • Festival Guide with listing of all vendors
  • Compostable tasting cup
  • Cocktail demos
  • Cool games
  • One of the finest views from Boston Harbor
  • Supporting the local food movement by raising much needed funds for the Boston Local Food Program

name.text: marlo marketing health and wellness series: summer/fall 2015 schedule
name.html: marlo marketing health and wellness series: summer/fall 2015 schedule

description.text:
Heard ofacupuncture, chia, craniosacral therapy, Homeopathy, IV Therapy, meditation, reflexology, Reiki and Shiatsu…but are unsure of what they all are? Hate the idea for popping a pill for every ill, but don’t know which alternative therapy would work for you?  If you want to take control of your health and wellness but don’t know where to begin, here’s a series that could change your life. 
Inspired by learnings from the agency’s health & wellness clients, marlo marketing is practicing what it preaches!  We’ve put together a series of fascinating presentations about top-trending alternative therapies, featuring leading experts in their field. These are NOT sales pitches, nor are the speakers agency clients.  The series is our way of connecting those who teach with those who want to learn in a friendly, welcoming environment for people at all levels of interest. 
The ongoing series kicks off this August with a summer/fall 2015 lineup of leading experts in their fields of yoga, anti-aging, weight loss, chinese herbs, acupuncture and meditation.

name.text: Innovation in Media // Panel and Networking
name.html: Innovation in Media // Panel and Networking

description.text:
With constant disruption in Media due to new technology and changing consumer needs, how does the New York Times fight to stay ahead of the curve?  How has CBS refined its content delivery to appeal to a modern audience?  How has Spotify revolutionized the distribution of music with its platform? How has Pixability turned YouTube into one of the most powerful media channels for brands? Hear answers to these important questions from a group of amazing panelists and learn what they think about the BIG question facing all facets of the industry: what’s next? 
  

  
This landmark event unites top innovators and thought leaders in Media to discuss how new ventures are shaping the future of the industry, and how established incumbents are evolving to stay relevant. In order to stay up to date and continue to innovate, it’s important for innovators and entrepreneurs to understand changes that have occurred in the past to be able to translate them to meet future demands.  
Panelists:                                                                                                                                                        
Martin Nisenholtz // Founder of New York Times Digital, Adjunct Professor and Advisor to Digital Media Companies 
Josh Karpf // Global Director, Social Marketing at Spotify 
Amy Young // Vice President, Video On Demand and Content Distribution, Network Sales at CBS 
Rob Ciampa // Chief Marketing Officer, Pixability 
  

  
Panel // 6:30-7:30pm 
Reception // 7:45-9:00pm

name.text: Tech Conference at Harvard Business School
name.html: Tech Conference at Harvard Business School

description.text:
What is the Tech Conference? 
Held at Harvard Business School for the past 20 years, the Tech Conference (formerly Cyberposium) is the largest student-run MBA technology conference in the world. Check out www.techconferencehbs.com for more information. 
Book early bird ticket pricing now (ticket prices include bento box lunch) 

  
Keynotes from HubSpot, Google, and LogMeIn!* 
  
Bill Wagner, LogMeIn (President and COO / incoming CEO) 
Topic: The 5 Dirty Little Secrets of the Internet of Things 
IoT may very well be the most hyped technology market since the Internet itself with gargantuan estimates of tens of billions of new connected devices and trillions of dollars in economic impact predicted by 2020. Bill Wagner, the president and incoming CEO of IoT pioneer LogMeIn, will demystify the transformative but too often misunderstood secret realities of the IoT - realities gleaned from dozens of IoT first movers - that may ultimately determine the winners and losers in the IoT era.  Jonathan Rochelle, Google (Co-founder of Google Docs and Google Drive) 
Topic: Startup Stories: Learnings and Lore from Google Docs, Drive and more 
Jonathan will reflect on the startup phase of Google Docs, beginning with Google Spreadsheets, and how his team kept the product growing within Google to create the Collaborative Productivity space. He will share key insights and learnings that may be useful for entrepreneurs building their own products in a seemingly well-defined space. 
Brian Halligan, HubSpot (Co-founder and CEO) 

  
Tech Talks in between our featured speakers: 
 •  Arun Agarwal: Co-Founder and CEO, Infinio 
   Topic: Moore's Law 
 •  Zack Anderson, Co-Founder and Chief Commercial Officer, Levant Power 
   Topic: Auto Tech 
 •  Julia Austin: Former VP of Innovation, VMware 
   Topic: Innovation in Big Companies 
 •  Bob Davis: General Partner, Highland Capital Partners 
   Topic: Venture Capital 
 •  Amit Garg: Venture Capitalist, Samsung Ventures 
    Topic: Corporate Venture Capital 
 •  David Klein: CEO, Commonbond 
   Topic: FinTech 
 •  Dan Koh: Chief of Staff to Boston Mayor Marty Walsh 
   Topic: Tech in Government 
 •  Rohit Prasad: Director of Machine Learning, Amazon Echo and Speech@Amazon 
   Topic: Machine Learning 
 •  Dr. Carissa Romero: Partner, Paradigm 
   Topic: Unconscious Bias in Tech 
 •  Bruce Snell: Cybersecurity and Privacy Director, Intel Security 
   Topic: Cybersecurity  Don't miss out, book the early bird ticket pricing now.   
*Please note agenda change. Dave Elkington (InsideSales.com) will no longer be able to attend. 

  
Who attends the Tech Conference? 
  
Each year, the Tech Conference seeks to unite the community of present and future business leaders who share a common passion to deliver technology’s greatest promises.  The conference draws some 1,000 attendees from the tech/media industries as well as the VC and startup communities. Participants include CEOs, CTOs, founders, entrepreneurs, Wall Street and technology analysts, a broad range of media and press representatives, and students from over 25 leading MBA programs around the world. 
  
What is Tech Conference 21 all about? 
  
Given this is the 21st year of the conference, there’s quite some history surrounding the conference. Many of the speakers that have spoken at the Tech Conference (or rather, its predecessor, Cyberposium) in the past got a lot more famous and a lot more successful after the conference, not because of the conference, but because conference organizers managed to bring to campus those people who saw the future and built it. Jeff Bezos came when Amazon was just a bookstore. Marissa Mayer came when she was still at Google, before she was selected as the CEO of Yahoo and became one of the most prominent CEOs in tech. Elon Musk came in 2005 before Tesla became the first American carmaker to IPO in decades and before NASA surrendered American leadership in space to SpaceX. Travis Kalanick came last year, before he closed that monstrous round that valued Uber at $18 billion.   The goal of this year’s conference is to continue the tradition of bringing industry leaders to HBS not only whose past stories would inspire and educate, but who are leading organizations that will likely dominate the next decade in technology. This year’s speakers can not only see the future, they are actively building it.

name.text: GH Fantasy Weekend - Boston, Mass  Nov 22, 2015
name.html: GH Fantasy Weekend - Boston, Mass  Nov 22, 2015

description.text:
Join us for our GH Fantasy Weekend on Sunday, November 22, 2015. We are bringing some of the hottest "General Hospital" stars to Boston, Mass! 
The GH Fantasy Weekend will be hosted by Tyler Christopher & Laura Wright, fan favorites from ABC's General Hospital.  The event will also feature Nancy Lee Grahn, Robert Palmer Watkins, Emme Rylan, Jason Thompson, William DeVry & Kirsten Storms - you'll get to see all of them for a star studded afternoon in Boston! Come spend the day with your GH favorites!  $328.00 tickets, Platinum- includes a 2 hour meet/greet with the actors for autographs and photo ops plus a 90 minute show- limited to 100 tickets. Doors will open at 10 am. for a 11 a.m. Platinum event.  Limit of 3 autographs per star. 
$175.00 tickets, VIP- includes the 90 minute show as well a group photo op at the end of the show. Doors will open at 1 p.m. for a 2 pm show show. VIP photo op is one photo op per person with the 8  actors in a group, VIP begins immediately following the show. Bring your own camera for the photo op. 
$118.00 tickets- Doors open at 1pm for  the ninety minute show beginning at 2 pm  featuring Q & A, interviews, and fan fun.  
$328 tickets, Post Platinum, Doors will open at 1pm includes the 90 minutes show which starts at 2pm plus a one hour limited event for under 50 people to meet/greet actors for autographs and photo ops. Limit of 3 autographs per star. 5 p.m. to 6 p.m. This event will take place after the VIP photo op. 
All ticket prices include local sales taxes. 
Bring your cameras but no videotaping allowed.  
Also, please note you must be 12 and over to attend the event. 
*All tickets are non refundable.  
 *Actors can be subject to change due to Acts of God, illness, means of transportation or anything else beyond the control of the Artist.

name.text: TSNE's 2015-16 Better Nonprofit Management Training Series
name.html: TSNE's 2015-16 Better Nonprofit Management Training Series

description.text:
The Better Nonprofit Management Training Series provides ongoing learning designed for nonprofit professionals. The series includes multiple workshops to help managers, staff, board members and other key stakeholders strengthen their management skills. Register now. 
For full workshop descriptions and series information visit http://tsne.org/training/better-nonprofit-management-training-series 
  
FAQs 
What is the refund policy? 
Cancellations must be made via email at least 10 business days prior to the date of the workshop in order to receive a refund (less a $15 processing fee). Email trainings@tsne.org should you need to cancel your registration. 
  
Where are your workshops located? 
Unless otherwise noted, all workshops are held at TSNE's NonProfit Center, conveniently located in Downtown Boston at 89 South Street, Boston 02111, near public transportation. For detailed directions, helpful information about visiting the NonProfit Center, and parking options please visit http://www.nonprofitcenterboston.org/directions 
  
Are there ID requirements? 
You will need valid identification to check in with security at the building's front desk. 
  
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? 
No, this is not necessary. 
  
Additional Questions?  
Email trainings@tsne.org

name.text: SEI Lecture Series: Jim Ziolkowski, Founder and CEO of buildOn
name.html: SEI Lecture Series: Jim Ziolkowski, Founder and CEO of buildOn

description.text:
Jim Ziolkowski is the best-selling author of Walk in Their Shoes and the Founder, President, and CEO of buildOn. At home and abroad, Ziolkowski's goal is to break the cycle of poverty, illiteracy, and low expectations through service and education. Inspired by his own travels to some of the most impoverished countries in the world and his days living in Harlem, Ziolkowski derailed his fast-track career in corporate finance at GE to dedicate his life to buildOn. 
 Ziolkowski will share his personal journey of founding buildOn and how this path has shaped his life and the lives of hundreds of children across the globe.  
 
  
The Social Enterprise Institute (SEI) Lecture Series is a monthly recurring speaker series at Northeastern University that serves to inform the general public of innovative enterprise solutions working across the international community and in our own backyard. SEI is DMSB's hub for social entrepreneurship and social innovation, with a focus on hands-on student engagement with global and local communities to address difficult social problems through business-driven solutions.  
  
This particular event is part of Northeastern's Global Entrepreneurship Week and International Education Week celebrations. 
A copy of Jim's book, Walk in Their Shoes, will be given to the first 150 attendees.

name.text: 12 Bars of X-Mas with Crawl In Boston
name.html: 12 Bars of X-Mas with Crawl In Boston

description.text:
Please join Crawl in Boston on 12/5/15 to tour the Faneuil Hall area to kick off the holiday season as we bring back the 12 Bars of X-Mas! 
Here are just some pictures from the past five years of this fantastic event. Please click below to check them out. 
2010 , 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014  
And here are some ideas from our Pinterest page 
Last year was an amazing experience for us. And we’re always trying to make things better for our crawlers. So we are making a few changes in hopes for an even more fun experience for you. 
It will be a very busy day as Santacon also takes place. We've already lined up our bars so we won't have any conflicts. We'll have plenty of room for our crawlers. And if you're attending one of those other events early, you can always join us afterwards if you can arrive by 3:00. 
Early bird tickets to the 12 Bars of X-Mas begin at $20. 
You will always get tons of bang for your buck with Crawl In Boston. We’re able to give away much more for our crawlers! 
Your ticket price will include: 
$3 or less drink at each bar 
Beverage Mitt   
Winter Pom Hat 
Santa Socks   
Koozie 
Drawstring Backpack   
Candy Cane 
Temporary Tattoos 
Photo Booth 
No Covers at Scheduled Bars 
Tickets are non-refundable. You must arrive to register by 3:00 or your ticket may be resold. Registration will be split up by last name at multiple bars for check in. So if you're coming with a group it might be easier for one person to buy the tickets in bulk and pick up all your goodies at once. 
Registration bars will be e-mailed to ticketed customers the week of the event. 
You will receive the entire schedule when you register in person at the event. We will have 12 bars participating. All the bars will be in the Faneuil Hall and Financial District areas. We are not releasing the schedule prior to the crawl to avoid crawl crashers. We want to keep this event as exclusive as possible for your own comfort. Visit crawlinboston.com for up to date information. Please note, the bars have the right to refuse entry to anyone due to bar capacity or personal incapacity. 
Please don’t wait to join this incredible event. Cheers! -C.I.B

description.text:
You are invited to join us as we celebrate the life and work of Dimitrios Trichopoulos. The symposium will feature discussions of Professor Trichopoulos' significant contributions to the field of Epidemiology and preventative medicine by his colleagues and friends. description.text:
Please join Animal Planet, New England Patriots Charitable Foundation and MSPCA-Angell for an all-star adoption event to help animals of all size, shape and breed find their forever homes. As part of Animal Planet’s ongoing mission to highlight the importance of animal adoption and responsible pet ownership, we will be covering the full cost of adoptions during this event on Tuesday, November 17, 2015. Sign-up* to join us from 2 PM to 4 PM EST for adorable adoptees, free giveaways and more.  
Additionally, every person that registers ahead of time is automatically entered to win a $100 gift card.  
Where: Massachusetts Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals-Angell Animal Medical Center - 350 South Huntington Avenue, Boston, MA 02130 
When: Tuesday, November 17, 2015 from 2 PM – 4 PM EST 
          
                         
  
*Animal Planet adoption fees coverage is on a first-come, first-served basis. Free giveaways while supplies last.  
Your registration and attendance constitutes your consent to being photographed, filmed and/or recorded by Discovery Communications and Animal Planet in connection to our Road to Puppy Bowl event

name.text: THE 44TH ANNUAL H. NAYLOR FITZHUGH CONFERENCE
name.html: THE 44TH ANNUAL H. NAYLOR FITZHUGH CONFERENCE

description.text:
ON BEHALF OF THE AFRICAN AMERICAN STUDENT UNION AT HARVARD BUSINESS SCHOOL, WE INVITE YOU TO THE 44TH ANNUAL H. NAYLOR FITZHUGH CONFERENCE. 
  
Keynote speakers include former Massachusetts Governor Deval Patrick, American Express CEO Kenneth Chenault and Grammy Award-winning artists and entrepreneurs Jay-Z and Alicia Keys! Register and get your tickets today! 
Visit our website! 
www.aasuconference.com 
  

  
About the Conference 
The H. Naylor Fitzhugh Conference, provides a significant forum for the exchange of knowledge and ideas critical to the success of African-American business and community leaders.  Each year, more than 500 current HBS students, alumni, faculty, prospective students, prominent business leaders, and community members attend the conference.  In 2002, the conference was formally named after H. Naylor Fitzhugh to honor the rich and inspirational legacy he left after graduating from Harvard Business School in 1933. 
  
The theme of the 2016 Conference is – Transcend: Redefining Expectations – where we will celebrate African-American achievements, inspire many new milestones, and provide a forum for attendees to take on issues facing our community such as: What is the African-American business community’s response to social injustice? Where do African-Americans fit in to the ever expanding definition of diversity? 
  
As you can see, this year's conference will be one for the ages.  You will not want to miss it. Buy your ticket today and we look forward to seeing you there!  
  
HBS AASU

name.text: Big City Moms Biggest Baby Shower Boston - 2015
name.html: Big City Moms Biggest Baby Shower Boston - 2015

description.text:
The Biggest Baby Shower Ever is like no other baby shower you've ever seen. With over 100 of the best companies in the baby industry, it's a one stop shop to test out, touch, feel and get educated on everything you can possibly need for your growing family. Enjoy mingling with other expectant and new parents while you enjoy sweet treats, mocktails and more in an elegant setting. 
The event will take place on Tuesday, December 8th at Back Bay Events Center  from 6:00pm-9:30pm (Super Pass entry is at 5:30pm)    
VENDORS 
Over 100 different companies will be represented including baby gear, accessories, furniture, clothing, skin care, parenting services, retailers, and more.  
GIFT BAGS AND MORE... 
Play games to win prizes including strollers, high chairs, diaper bags, car seats, bedding, bibs, clothing, decor and much more. Plus, everyone will go home with gift bags. 
SEMINARS 
We've scouted out the best of the best...Come hear from experts on important topics ranging from sleep safety to healthy eating to navigating Boston as a new mom. Special gifts and prizes will be given to all attendees of the seminars. 
GET PAMPERED! 
Style experts will be on hand to help you look your best and get that "pregnancy glow"...take a load off and relax with a massage or two with leading skincare lines. 
FOOD 
Pregnancy cravings have your taste buds in a frenzy? Enjoy light bites, sweet treats, and more. Plus, sip the Big City Moms signature mocktail, that will have you yearning for more - long after your 4th trimester. 
  
  
Frequently Asked Questions 
What is the difference between a basic, standard, a super, and an ultimate pass? 
Basic ticket holders have access to the event. This ticket does not include a gift bag or the bingo card game. Standard pass ticket holders and Super pass ticket holders each get gift bags and can play baby shower bingo. 
Super pass ticket holders have access to the event at 5:30pm, and get a Beco Baby carrier. 
Ultimate pass ticket holders have access to the event at 5:30pm, and get a Beco Baby carrier and a Britax Stroller. 
  
My Husband would like to join in on the fun - Will he feel out of place?  Husbands are absolutely welcome to join in on the fun! Please take advantage of our special couples ticket pricing. It's also helpful to have an extra set of hands to help carry all the gifts you will get! 
I would like to bring a friend with me - Do they need to purchase a ticket as well? Yes - every attendee must purchase a ticket. You can take advantage of our special "couples ticket pricing" or purchase 2 individual tickets and get twice the SWAG. 
What is a Baby Shower Bingo Card? Baby Shower Bingo is a fun game that we play at the event - this bingo card is your card to get your Big Baby Shower Gift.  This game is optional. 
What is the gift? 
Your gift can be anything from a diaper bag, stroller, car seat, highchair, crib, clothing, gift certificates, feeding gear, bedding, monitors, toys, etc. The gifts are completey random. 
What if I do not like my gift or I already own the gift I received? 
The gifts are given out randomly. Feel free to gift your item to a friend, another attendee, or charity. Unfortunatley there will be no exhanges. 
What's in the gift bag? Full size products as well as samples, magazines, food treats, and some coupons. 
  
Is this event for children?  This event is for new and expectant parents only. You may bring a baby in a carrier. Unfortunately the venue can not accommodate strollers. 
Are there contests that take place during the event? YES! Many companies will hold individual contests at their tables. Please note: these contests are not managed by Big City Moms - therefore anything won or any prizes uncollected from the contest should be worked out directly with the company. Big City Moms will not be held responsible for defective or uncollected winnings. 
Gift Bag Policy 
Please note there is a limit of one gift bag per family. Gift bags are required to be picked up at the show during exhibitor hours. Gift bags cannot be mailed or picked up at a different location on another date. 
Cancellation Policy Due to the nature of this event absolutely no refunds will be given after  November 30th.   Any ticket purchased after 11/30 is not refundable. 
If you have any questions please email us at Info@bigcitymoms.com

name.text: 100-Day Plan Listen and Learn for BPS Families
name.html: 100-Day Plan Listen and Learn for BPS Families

description.text:
The 100-Day Plan identifies core values that will guide the work of the district based on input from students, families, staff, community members and partners.  The 100-Day plan began on September 8, 2015, and we are continuing to listen and learn about what our schools are doing well and what we need to do in order to better support all of our students.  Your continued input throughout this process will inform our Three-Year Plan that will be unveiled in September 2016.  
Please attend a 100-Day Plan Listen and Learn session for families to provide feedback on the expansion of Advanced Work Classes, aligning BPS Graduation Requirements to the state recommended Mass Core and redesigning central offices to better support school communities.  Child care and interpretation (must request by RSVP date) will be available at all meetings. 
These events are co-sponsored with the Citywide Parent Council and the Boston SpedPac. 
  
DATES AND TOPICS: 
Thursday, November 19, 7 - 8:30 pm 
Topics: Advanced Work Classes (AWC) and Mass Core /BPS Graduation Requirements 
Murphy K-8 School 
1 Worrell St 
Dorchester, MA 02122.   
RSVP by Tuesday, November 17.  
Monday, November 23, 6:30 - 8 pm 
Topic:  Redesigning Central offices to better support school communities 
School Committee Room, 2nd floor, Bolling Building 
2300 Washington Street 
Roxbury, MA  02119 
RSVP by Friday, November 20.

description.text:
AGENDA 

Org cleanup, auditing, comparison and lifecycle management
Cloud-to-cloud backup and recovery 
Use cases for Process Builder and Flow
Experiences rolling out Lightning (W16 release)
And more....    

LOGISTICS 
Please note the main session will begin promptly at 3:30. We recommend you arrive early for check-in and networking. Reminder: the virtual home for this group is now on the Success Community.     
ABOUT OUR SPONSORS 
 DreamFactory is the world's leading publisher of rich web applications for cloud platforms. Our products combine the agility of on demand delivery with the performance of desktop applications. DreamFactory delivers enterprise class software solutions to over 40,000 businesses using Force.com.  
 OwnBackup is a leading cloud-to-cloud backup & restore vendor. We provide secure, automated, daily backups of SaaS & PaaS data as well as sophisticated data compare & restore tools for disaster recovery. OwnBackup’s solution complements Salesforce by covering data loss & corruption caused by human errors, malicious intent, integration errors, and rogue applications.   
We're looking forward to a great event, 
David Pier and Matt Bertuzzi Boston User Group Leaders

name.text: 2015 NEWIEE Fall Fête
name.html: 2015 NEWIEE Fall Fête

description.text:
2015 NEWIEE Fall Fête 
Please join NEWIEE for our Fall Fête! It will be a night of fun and a chance to meet the NEWIEE Board and  Advisory Board. The Fall Fête is open to everyone (members, non-members, women, men, etc.). Admission includes drinks, hors d'oeuvres, and lively conversation at the Algonquin Club of Boston. Dress code is "professional festive."  
Board of Directors 

Jacqueline Ashmore, Fraunhofer USA - Center for Sustainable Energy Systems
Beth Barton, Day Pitney, LLP
Jennifer Bernazani-Ludlum, American Tower Company
Judy Chang, The Brattle Group 
Audrea Lafelly, Digitas
Julie Lieberman, Concentric Energy Advisors
Sharon C. Lincoln, Foley Hoag, LLP
Joey Lee Miranda, Robinson & Cole
Mary Usovicz, TRC Companies, Inc.
Carter Wall, Franklin Beach Energy 
Katy E. Ward, Mintz, Levin, Cohn, Ferris, Glovsky and Popeo, P.C.

Advisory Board 

Alicia Barton, Chief of Operations, Global Utility at SunEdison 
Susan Coakley, Executive Director at Northeast Energy Efficiency Partnerships
Carrie Cullen Hitt, Senior Director, Project Development, NextEra Energy Resources
Catherine Finneran Director, Environmental Affairs at Eversource 
Sonia Hamel, Principal at Hamel Environmental Consulting
Edna Karanian, Director of Gas Supply at Eversource Energy
Barbara Kates-Garnick, Professor of Practice,  Fletcher School, Tufts University, Research Fellow, CIERP
Muriel Robinette, Senior Environmental Hydrogeologist/Senior Principal at Terracon Consultants, Inc.
Rebecca Tepper, Energy Chief, Massachusetts Attorney General's Office

If you have any questions about the event, please contact Katy Ward at keward@mintz.com. Dress is business casual. 
Please note that we will be unable to give refunds for tickets within a week of the Fall Fête. 
NEWIEE may on occasion take photographs and/or video of event attendees for use in print materials or by electronic methods. Your attendance at any NEWIEE event grants permission for NEWIEE to use these photographs and/or video in its marketing and public relations efforts. 
  
  
  
Valet Services 
  
 Valet attendants are available during dining hours at the Club and special events.  Valet costs $24 (cash only!)  
  
Access from the T 
  
The Algonquin Club is close to both the Copley Square and Hynes Convention Center  Green Line Stations, though we are closest to Copley.  
  
From Copley: Head north on Dartmouth Street, walk two blocks and turn left onto Commonwealth Avenue, and we are located between Exeter and Fairfield.  
  
From Hynes: head north on Massachusetts Avenue, walk two blocks and turn right onto Commonwealth Avenue, and we are located between Fairfield and Exeter.  
  
Driving Directions 
  
From the North: 
  
From either Rt. 93 or Rt. 1, exit on Storrow Drive. Follow Storrow Drive to the Copley Square / Back Bay exit. Exit left and take a right at the first set of lights onto Beacon Street. From Beacon Street, take your 4th left onto Exeter Street. From Exeter Street, take your 1st right onto Commonwealth Avenue. The Algonquin Club will be on your right. 
 From the South: 
  
Take Rt. 93 North through Boston and get off at the Storrow Drive exit. Follow Storrow Drive to the Copley Square / Back Bay exit. Exit left and take a right at the first set of lights onto Beacon Street. From Beacon Street, take your 4th left onto Exeter Street. From Exeter Street, take your 1st right onto Commonwealth Avenue. The Algonquin Club will be on your right. 
  
From the Massachusetts Turnpike (Mass Pike): 
  
Take the Copley Square exit and bear left onto Dartmouth Street. From Dartmouth Street, take your 4th left onto Commonwealth Avenue. The Algonquin Club will be 1½ intersections (blocks) down on your right. 
  
From Logan Airport: 
  
Take the Sumner Tunnel to the John Fitzgerald Expressway / rt. 93 North (this is an "up" ramp directly outside the tunnel. Get off at the Storrow Drive exit. Follow Storrow Drive to the Copley Square/Back Bay exit. Exit left and take a right at the first set of lights onto Beacon. From Beacon Street, take your 4th left onto Exeter Street. From Exeter Street, take your 1st right onto Commonwealth Avenue. The Algonquin Club will be on your right.

name.text: ProtoHack - The Code Free Hackathon For Designers & Business People - Boston, MA
name.html: ProtoHack - The Code Free Hackathon For Designers & Business People - Boston, MA

description.text:
ProtoHack exists to show non-coders that they can create something amazing from nothing. We empower and enable the non-technical community with the tools, knowledge and connections that will help bring their idea to life and visually communicate it through prototyping. 
How does it work? 



No coding is required. Instead you will use prototyping tools, drag and drop editors, mockups, wireframes and anything else you can think of to VISUALLY demo your idea on stage. (We’ve put together the best tools for non-coders, so don’t fret if you’ve never prototyped.)


Although we encourage you to try some prototyping tools prior to attending ProtoHack, we will begin ProtoHack with optional educational workshops on how to use some of the top prototyping tools.


You can choose to prototype alone or form a team with other participants and decide on an idea together. Teams can be up to 5 people.


You will have 9 hours to produce a prototype. (Remember, you are creating a lean prototype of your idea and it doesn't need to be perfect. The focus should be on visually showing what the idea is.)


At the end, you or your team will present on stage to a panel of judges consisting of developers and investors to get feedback.  

  
Judges: 
Owen Johnson, Managing Director and C0-Founder of the top nationally ranked startup accelerator Betaspring, which has made 90 seed stage investments.  
Hannah Chung, Co-Founder and Chief Creative Officer of Sproutel, the creators of the internationally renowned and award winning Jerry the Bear personal healthcare robot for children with Type 1 Diabetes, Chronic Asthma and Food Allergies. She has been named a woman under 30 to watch in High tech by Forbes and won a national pitch competition judged by the legendary investor Warren Buffet. 
  
  
  
Nadeem Mazen; Polymath, Design Thinker, Designer, Artist & Engineer. CEO of the Maker Space Danger!Awesome. 
Julien L. Pham M.D., Nephrologist & Founder of Boston HealthIT startup RubiconMD and a global nomad ( his words - as he is French /Vietnamese).   
  
 Product Mentors: 
Amos Epstein, CEO of clean tech startup TankUtility, which is in the Internet of Things space and a graduate of StartupNext Boston.  
  
Matt Bilotti, Product Manager at Drift, a respected Boston -based customer engagement and product design and innovation consultancy.  
  
  
  
Pitch Mentors: 
  
Raffi Tchakmakjian, Co-Founder and CEO of fitness tech startup LIFTsession; Y - Combinator approved angel investor.  
  
  
  
Growth Hacker Mentor: 
  
Irene Pylypenko, has run 17 hackathons as Director of Hacking Health, including the world's largest healthcare hackathon with 500 participants.  
  
  
  
Design Mentors:  
Stephen D. Roger, Product and Design Strategist at Intrepid Pursuits.  
  
Four Hewes - product & experience designer mentoring startups, institutions, events, teams, and enterprises create memorable experiences that people want.  
  

  
Looking for the Agenda? Click here  




 

Interested in speaking at ProtoHack? Are you a non-technical founder or entrepreneur?    Learn more about ProtoHack and how to become our keynote speaker by emailing us at info@protohack.org. ProtoHack is a 501(c)(3) and cannot pay their speakers. 



What's in it for me? 


  
ProtoHack will be a 12-hour experience where you will build a prototype that communicates an idea visually. 


Learn how to effectively use industry leading tools to put together a prototype and visually communicate your idea.


Meet other like-minded people with various backgrounds in design, business, marketing, product management and more who are all excited and passionate about building something. 


Become a better product person with a deeper understanding of UX.


Exclusive access to over $200 in prototyping tools and sponsor related goodies.


We will also invite developers who are looking for new projects, to come and watch the presentations so they have a no-pressure opportunity to contact you if they’re interested in helping you actually code your prototype. 

 


Learn more about ProtoHack by visiting our website.

name.text: Starting UP! Entrepreneurship Seminar
name.html: Starting UP! Entrepreneurship Seminar

description.text:
MPC Seminar Event
 
 Reception 6 - 7 pm. Panel begins at 7 pm.
 
Craft Beer & Light Fare Served
 
Registration is accepted at the door. Ticket orders may also be placed online at any time on the day of the event. 
 
 
Starting Up! 
Join us for a lively panel discussion on entrepreneurship with founders from unique companies in the video content, advertising, and media entertainment industries.  
Learn how they got started. Their motivations, ambitions, and challenges. And what makes starting new ventures in media and creative organizations unique for services and products. Get tips, stories, and inspiring perspectives that might even trigger the entrepreneur in you! 
  
Meet the Panel  
Tim Cawley : Co-founder, Chief Creative Officer; SLEEK MACHINE 
Tim Cawley is the Chief Creative Officer and Co-Founder of Sleek Machine, an advertising and PR firm built to make ideas that make news. He's a 20-year industry veteran whose portfolio includes Century 21, Starwood Hotels, Major League Baseball, JetBlue, Dunkin’ Donuts, and many others. Archive Magazine ranks him as one of the top ten U.S. writers of all time.  
Tim also directed and produced From Nothing, Something – a feature-length documentary which was picked up for distribution by The Orchard and released worldwide in 2015.  sleekmachine.com  
  
  
Brendan Lattrell : Founder, CEO; GRAPEVINE 
Brendan is the Founder and CEO of Grapevine, which helps independent producers on YouTube build careers in online video. Over 20,000 YouTubers reaching a billion people monthly utilize their platform to produce content for companies like Walgreens and collaborate with each other on projects.  
Before founding Grapevine Brendan was a producer for networks including History Channel and Discovery Channel.  grapevinelogic.com 
  
    
Dan Levin : Founder, President, COO ; VIRALGAINS 
Starting his first successful ad company at the age of 19, Dan is versed at envisioning and executing the big picture. His experience as a founder of three start-ups in 7 years has taught him one thing: there's always something broken at a start-up, and it's his job to resolve issues early on before they accelerate.   
ViralGains puts branded video in front of targeted audiences for maximum exposure, engagement and results – creating authentic relationships between consumers and advertisers through the power of online video.  viralgains.com 
  
  
Angela Peri : Founder ; MEDIA PERFORMANCE, BOSTON CASTING  
Angela Peri, founder of Boston Casting, has cast hundreds of national and regional productions from feature films to commercials and industrial media. She has worked with top directors including David O. Russell, Seth MacFarlane and Errol Morris.  
Media Performance, a new division of Boston Casting, provides customized training for CEO’s, politicians, lawyers, professional athletes, and business professionals to develop their skills and enhance their careers in media performance and public speaking. bostoncasting.com 
  
   
Brynmore Williams : DIRECTOR & CINEMATOGRAPHER 
Brynmore Williams is an award-winning Director and Cinematographer with a passion for telling stories of second chances and new beginnings. His work spans documentary, advertising and TV, but to each he brings his unique visual style and storytelling ability.  Brynmore was a camera operator on the highly successful unscripted reality show Boston’s Finest.  
Brynmore's commercial clients include Hill Holiday, The New York Times, BBC, The City of Cambridge, The Boston Globe, Monster.com, Harvard University, The Wall Street Journal, and many others.  brynmore.com 
   
Danielle Weiss Medina : CEO & Executive Producer ; MAD FUSION 
Danielle Weiss Medina is a producer who specializes in developing and producing thought-provoking, entertaining and authentic television. She has produced more than 175 hours of television on subjects including pop culture, pro-social topics, politics, music, current events, lifestyles and more. 
Bringing original content to all media platforms, Mad Fusion has developed and produced shows for networks including A+E, HGTV, OWN, MTV, VH-1 and Food Network.  madfusion.com 
    
  
Moderated By Eran Lobel : CEO & Executive Producer, ELEMENT 
Eran started ELEMENT in 1998 and has grown it into one of Boston’s premiere full-service production and post-production companies. A seasoned entrepreneur in the video industry, Eran is passionate about content marketing and syndication, and leveraging innovative video technology across platforms.  
Eran recently co-founded an unscripted television programming company called Milkman, working with Food Network, VH1, DIY and A&E. elementproductions.com 
  
  
     
MPC Membership 
Join the Mass Production Coalition (MPC) online today to become part of MA's largest organization of film and media professionals and companies while supporting initiatives that grow the state's industry.   
For membership inquiries contact: info@massprodcoalition.org.

name.text: International Media Education Summit 2015
name.html: International Media Education Summit 2015

description.text:
The 8th Media Education Summit brings together a global network of media educators, scholars and researchers to share research, pedagogy and innovation on all aspects of media education and media in education. 
The Summit is convened annually by the Centre for Excellence in Media Practice (CEMP), Bournemouth University and hosted this year by Emerson College, Boston, US. Emerson is the home of the Engagement Lab. The Boston Summit incorporates the 2015 Media Literacy Research Symposium. 
 Presenters will be invited to submit their work to a special edition of the Media Education Research Journal (MERJ) and the Journal of Media Literacy Education (JMLE). 
  
 Please note that before placing an order, you will be asked to agree to Bournemouth University’s terms and conditions (see below). Please read these terms carefully and make sure you understand them before ordering any Products. 
 Bournemouth University’s Online Event Terms and Conditions - please click here

The Summit is convened annually by the Centre for Excellence in Media Practice (CEMP), Bournemouth University and hosted this year by Emerson College, Boston, US. Emerson is the home of the Engagement Lab. The Boston Summit incorporates the 2015 Media Literacy Research Symposium.

Presenters will be invited to submit their work to a special edition of the Media Education Research Journal (MERJ) and the Journal of Media Literacy Education (JMLE).

Please note that before placing an order, you will be asked to agree to Bournemouth University’s terms and conditions (see below). Please read these terms carefully and make sure you understand them before ordering any Products.

Bournemouth University’s Online Event Terms and Conditions - please click here

name.text: Building Inclusive Communities: Neighborhoods to Nations Global Conference
name.html: Building Inclusive Communities: Neighborhoods to Nations Global Conference

description.text:
Conference 
The Building Inclusive Communities conference, hosted by UMass Boston's School for Global Inclusion and Social Development, brings together leaders across industries and disciplines to foster new strategies for increased inclusion. Our attendees and presenters are policymakers, educators, faith leaders, and entrepreneurs–as well as self-advocates who are making inclusion a reality in underserved populations. 
The conference will be held December 3-4th at Boston’s Park Plaza Hotel. The conference times are from 8:30-5pm on December 3rd and 8:30-4:30 PM on December 4th. 
  
Awards Reception 
The second annual Beacon for Global Inclusion Awards is presented by The School for Global Inclusion and Social Development at UMass Boston. These awards honor individuals and organizations who empower individuals to achieve inclusion in their communities. The reception is December 3rd from 5:30 - 7:30 PM at the Edward M. Kennedy Institute. 
If you'd like more information about the conference please visit our webpage at www.buildinginclusion.org
